DOC.brief_summary: The study aims to investigate the prevalence and treatment of nausea and/or vomiting in patients with advanced cancer not receiving chemotherapy or irradiation.
DOC.brief_title: DAnish Nausea Study In Advanced Cancer-Epidemiology: A Danish Multicenter Trial to Investigate the Prevalence and Treatment of Nausea and/or Vomiting in Patients With Advanced Cancer.
DOC.criteria: 1. Advanced cancer 2. Age ≥ 18 years 3. Ability to read and understand the forms required for the study 4. Lifeexpectancy more than 2 weeks. 5. Nausea score ≥ 'a little' on the extended EORTC QLQC15PAL (item 9) 1. Surgery to the brain or abdomen within the last 2 weeks or exposure to general anesthesia within the last 4 days. 2. Chemotherapy or radiation therapy within the last 4 weeks 3. Symptoms of increased intracranial pressure or cerebral metastasis. If this is suspected, a normal MRI scan of the cerebrum is needed before inclusion 4. Radiologically confirmed ileus, or strong clinical suspicion evaluated by the study Investigator 5. Pregnancy
